intro: Neea longipedunculata, commonly known as the long-stemmed neea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, commonly known as the heath family. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated peduncles that bear clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, providing a striking contrast to the delicate blooms. Neea longipedunculata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
